decision_conditions: The roof area of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the local planning authority.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification), no window(s)/door(s) shall be installed in the flank elevation(s) of the development hereby permitted without the prior permission in writing of the local planning authority.

<p>The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:&nbsp;</p><p>Reasonable Exception Statement; Design and Heritage Statement; Location Plan; Block Plan, 1114<br></p>
The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

<p><span style="line-height:115%">The proposed&nbsp;rooflight windows hereby approved shall be of the conservation type: formed in black painted metal,&nbsp;fitted flush with the existing roof slope and shall not project above the plane of the roof.</span></p><p><br></p>

<p>Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, the brickwork bond (ie.&nbsp;the arrangement of bricks) type, size, colour, face bond, pointing, coursing, jointing, profile and texture shall match the existing on the building and the single storey rear extension shall be provided with a brick on edge creasing parapet (to be no higher than the approved built form),&nbsp;unless otherwise first approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p>
The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.
description: Single storey rear extension; roof lights in front and rear roof slopes (Demolition of single storey rear extension)
